AccountCallBuilder.name: AccountCallBuilder
AccountCallBuilder.description:
Creates a new AccountCallBuilder pointed to server defined by serverUrl.

Do not create this object directly, use Server#accounts.

accountId.name: accountId
accountId.description: Returns information and links relating to a single account. The balances section in the returned JSON will also list all the trust lines this account has set up.

incrementSequenceNumber.name: incrementSequenceNumber
incrementSequenceNumber.description: Increments sequence number in this object by one.

incrementSequenceNumber.description: Increments sequence number in this object by one.

forCode.name: forCode
forCode.description: This endpoint filters all assets by the asset code.

forIssuer.name: forIssuer
forIssuer.description: This endpoint filters all assets by the asset issuer.

CallBuilder.name: CallBuilder
CallBuilder.description:
Creates a new CallBuilder pointed to server defined by serverUrl.

This is an abstract class. Do not create this object directly, use Server class.

setAllowHttp.name: setAllowHttp
setAllowHttp.description: Sets allowHttp flag globally. When set to true, connections to insecure http protocol servers will be allowed. Must be set to false in production. Default: false.

setDefault.name: setDefault
setDefault.description: Sets all global config flags to default values.

forAccount.name: forAccount
forAccount.description: This endpoint represents all effects that changed a given account. It will return relevant effects from the creation of the account to the current ledger.

forAccount.name: forAccount
forAccount.description: This endpoint represents all operations that were included in valid transactions that affected a particular account.

forAccount.name: forAccount
forAccount.description: This endpoint responds with a collection of Payment operations where the given account was either the sender or receiver.

forAccount.name: forAccount
forAccount.description: This endpoint represents all transactions that affected a given account.

forLedger.name: forLedger
forLedger.description:
Effects are the specific ways that the ledger was changed by any operation.

This endpoint represents all effects that occurred in the given ledger.

forLedger.name: forLedger
forLedger.description: This endpoint returns all operations that occurred in a given ledger.

forLedger.name: forLedger
forLedger.description: This endpoint represents all payment operations that are part of a valid transactions in a given ledger.

forLedger.name: forLedger
forLedger.description: This endpoint represents all transactions in a given ledger.

forTransaction.name: forTransaction
forTransaction.description: This endpoint represents all effects that occurred as a result of a given transaction.

forTransaction.name: forTransaction
forTransaction.description: This endpoint represents all operations that are part of a given transaction.

forTransaction.name: forTransaction
forTransaction.description: This endpoint represents all payment operations that are part of a given transaction.

forOperation.name: forOperation
forOperation.description: This endpoint represents all effects that occurred as a result of a given operation.

inherits.name: inherits
inherits.description:
From: https://github.com/joyent/node/blob/master/lib/util.js Inherit the prototype methods from one constructor into another.

The Function.prototype.inherits from lang.js rewritten as a standalone function (not on Function.prototype). NOTE: If this file is to be loaded during bootstrapping this function needs to be rewritten using some native functions as prototype setup using normal JavaScript does not work as expected during bootstrapping (see mirror.js in r114903).

resolve.name: resolve
resolve.description:
This method is a helper method for handling user inputs that contain destination value. It accepts two types of values:

  • For Payshares address (ex. bob*payshares.org) it splits Payshares address and then tries to find information about federation server in payshares.toml file for a given domain. It returns a Promise which resolves if federation server exists and user has been found and rejects in all other cases.
  • For Account ID (ex. GB5XVAABEQMY63WTHDQ5RXADGYF345VWMNPTN2GFUDZT57D57ZQTJ7PS) it returns a Promise which resolves if Account ID is valid and rejects in all other cases. Please note that this method does not check if the account actually exists in a ledger.

Example:

It returns a Promise that will resolve to a JSON object with following fields:

  • account_id - Account ID of the destination,
  • memo_type (optional) - Memo type that needs to be attached to a transaction,
  • memo (optional) - Memo value that needs to be attached to a transaction.

The Promise will reject in case of any errors.

resolve.name: resolve
resolve.description: Returns a parsed payshares.toml file for a given domain. Returns a Promise that resolves to the parsed payshares.toml object. If payshares.toml file does not exist for a given domain or is invalid Promise will reject.

createForDomain.name: createForDomain
createForDomain.description: Creates a FederationServer instance based on information from payshares.toml file for a given domain. Returns a Promise that resolves to a FederationServer object. If payshares.toml file does not exist for a given domain or it does not contain information about a federation server Promise will reject.

resolveAddress.name: resolveAddress
resolveAddress.description: Returns a Promise that resolves to federation record if the user was found for a given Payshares address.

resolveAccountId.name: resolveAccountId
resolveAccountId.description: Returns a Promise that resolves to federation record if the user was found for a given account ID.

resolveTransactionId.name: resolveTransactionId
resolveTransactionId.description: Returns a Promise that resolves to federation record if the sender of the transaction was found for a given transaction ID.

LedgerCallBuilder.name: LedgerCallBuilder
LedgerCallBuilder.description:
Creates a new LedgerCallBuilder pointed to server defined by serverUrl.

Do not create this object directly, use Server#ledgers.

OperationCallBuilder.name: OperationCallBuilder
OperationCallBuilder.description:
Creates a new OperationCallBuilder pointed to server defined by serverUrl.

Do not create this object directly, use Server#operations.

operation.name: operation
operation.description: The operation details endpoint provides information on a single operation. The operation ID provided in the id argument specifies which operation to load.

PaymentCallBuilder.name: PaymentCallBuilder
PaymentCallBuilder.description:
Creates a new PaymentCallBuilder pointed to server defined by serverUrl.

Do not create this object directly, use Server#payments.

accounts.name: accounts
accounts.description: Returns new AccountCallBuilder object configured by a current Horizon server configuration.

ledgers.name: ledgers
ledgers.description: Returns new LedgerCallBuilder object configured by a current Horizon server configuration.

transactions.name: transactions
transactions.description: Returns new TransactionCallBuilder object configured by a current Horizon server configuration.

offers.name: offers
offers.description: People on the Payshares network can make offers to buy or sell assets. This endpoint represents all the offers a particular account makes. Currently this method only supports querying offers for account and should be used like this:

orderbook.name: orderbook
orderbook.description: Returns new OrderbookCallBuilder object configured by a current Horizon server configuration.

trades.name: trades
trades.description: Returns new TradesCallBuilder object configured by a current Horizon server configuration.

operations.name: operations
operations.description: Returns new OperationCallBuilder object configured by a current Horizon server configuration.

paths.name: paths
paths.description:
The Payshares Network allows payments to be made between assets through path payments. A path payment specifies a series of assets to route a payment through, from source asset (the asset debited from the payer) to destination asset (the asset credited to the payee).

A path search is specified using:

  • The destination address
  • The source address
  • The asset and amount that the destination account should receive

As part of the search, horizon will load a list of assets available to the source address and will find any payment paths from those source assets to the desired destination asset. The search's amount parameter will be used to determine if there a given path can satisfy a payment of the desired amount.

Returns new PathCallBuilder object configured with the current Horizon server configuration.

payments.name: payments
payments.description: Returns new PaymentCallBuilder object configured with the current Horizon server configuration.

effects.name: effects
effects.description: Returns new EffectCallBuilder object configured with the current Horizon server configuration.

friendbot.name: friendbot
friendbot.description: Returns new FriendbotBuilder object configured with the current Horizon server configuration.

assets.name: assets
assets.description: Returns new AssetsCallBuilder object configured with the current Horizon server configuration.

loadAccount.name: loadAccount
loadAccount.description: Fetches an account's most current state in the ledger and then creates and returns an Account object.

forAssetPair.name: forAssetPair
forAssetPair.description: Filter trades for a specific asset pair (orderbook)

TransactionCallBuilder.name: TransactionCallBuilder
TransactionCallBuilder.description:
Creates a new TransactionCallBuilder pointed to server defined by serverUrl.

Do not create this object directly, use Server#transactions.

transaction.name: transaction
transaction.description: The transaction details endpoint provides information on a single transaction. The transaction hash provided in the hash argument specifies which transaction to load.

native.name: native
native.description: Returns an asset object for the native asset.

fromOperation.name: fromOperation
fromOperation.description: Returns an asset object from its XDR object representation.

toXDRObject.name: toXDRObject
toXDRObject.description: Returns the xdr object for this asset.

getAssetType.name: getAssetType
getAssetType.description:
Return the asset type. Can be one of following types:

  • native
  • credit_alphanum4
  • credit_alphanum12

isNative.name: isNative
isNative.description: Returns true if this asset object is the native asset.

equals.name: equals
equals.description: Returns true if this asset equals the given asset.

fromSecret.name: fromSecret
fromSecret.description: Creates a new Keypair instance from secret. This can either be secret key or secret seed depending on underlying public-key signature system. Currently Keypair only supports ed25519.

fromBase58Seed.name: fromBase58Seed
fromBase58Seed.description: Base58 address encoding is DEPRECATED! Use this method only for transition to psrkey encoding.

fromRawEd25519Seed.name: fromRawEd25519Seed
fromRawEd25519Seed.description: Creates a new Keypair object from ed25519 secret key seed raw bytes.

fromPublicKey.name: fromPublicKey
fromPublicKey.description: Creates a new Keypair object from public key.

publicKey.name: publicKey
publicKey.description: Returns public key associated with this Keypair object.

secret.name: secret
secret.description: Returns secret key associated with this Keypair object

canSign.name: canSign
canSign.description: Returns true if this Keypair object contains secret key and can sign.

hash.name: hash
hash.description: Returns a hash for this transaction, suitable for signing.

fromXDRObject.name: fromXDRObject
fromXDRObject.description: Converts the XDR Operation object to the opts object used to create the XDR operation.

Networks.name: Networks
Networks.description:
Contains passphrases for common networks:

  • Networks.PUBLIC: Public Global Payshares Network ; September 2015
  • Networks.TESTNET: Test SDF Network ; September 2015

networkId.name: networkId
networkId.description: Returns Network ID. Network ID is SHA-256 hash of network passphrase.

AuthRequiredFlag.name: AuthRequiredFlag
AuthRequiredFlag.description: When set using Operation.setOptions option, requires the issuing account to give other accounts permission before they can hold the issuing account’s credit.

AuthRevocableFlag.name: AuthRevocableFlag
AuthRevocableFlag.description: When set using Operation.setOptions option, allows the issuing account to revoke its credit held by other accounts.

AuthImmutableFlag.name: AuthImmutableFlag
AuthImmutableFlag.description: When set using Operation.setOptions option, then none of the authorization flags can be set and the account can never be deleted.

Operation.name: Operation
Operation.description:
Operation class represents operations in Payshares network. Use one of static methods to create operations:

  • Operation.createAccount
  • Operation.payment
  • Operation.pathPayment
  • Operation.manageOffer
  • Operation.createPassiveOffer
  • Operation.setOptions
  • Operation.changeTrust
  • Operation.allowTrust
  • Operation.accountMerge
  • Operation.inflation
  • Operation.manageData

createAccount.name: createAccount
createAccount.description: Create and fund a non existent account.

pathPayment.name: pathPayment
pathPayment.description: Returns a XDR PaymentOp. A "payment" operation send the specified amount to the destination account, optionally through a path. XPS payments create the destination account if it does not exist.

changeTrust.name: changeTrust
changeTrust.description: Returns an XDR ChangeTrustOp. A "change trust" operation adds, removes, or updates a trust line for a given asset from the source account to another. The issuer being trusted and the asset code are in the given Asset object.

allowTrust.name: allowTrust
allowTrust.description: Returns an XDR AllowTrustOp. An "allow trust" operation authorizes another account to hold your account's credit for a given asset.

setOptions.name: setOptions
setOptions.description:
Returns an XDR SetOptionsOp. A "set options" operations set or clear account flags, set the account's inflation destination, and/or add new signers to the account. The flags used in opts.clearFlags and opts.setFlags can be the following:

  • AuthRequiredFlag
  • AuthRevocableFlag
  • AuthImmutableFlag

It's possible to set/clear multiple flags at once using logical or.

manageOffer.name: manageOffer
manageOffer.description: Returns a XDR ManageOfferOp. A "manage offer" operation creates, updates, or deletes an offer.

createPassiveOffer.name: createPassiveOffer
createPassiveOffer.description: Returns a XDR CreatePasiveOfferOp. A "create passive offer" operation creates an offer that won't consume a counter offer that exactly matches this offer. This is useful for offers just used as 1:1 exchanges for path payments. Use manage offer to manage this offer after using this operation to create it.

manageData.name: manageData
manageData.description: This operation adds data entry to the ledger.

encodeEd25519PublicKey.name: encodeEd25519PublicKey
encodeEd25519PublicKey.description: Encodes data to psrkey ed25519 public key.

decodeEd25519PublicKey.name: decodeEd25519PublicKey
decodeEd25519PublicKey.description: Decodes psrkey ed25519 public key to raw data.

isValidEd25519PublicKey.name: isValidEd25519PublicKey
isValidEd25519PublicKey.description: Returns true if the given Payshares public key is a valid ed25519 public key.

decodeEd25519SecretSeed.name: decodeEd25519SecretSeed
decodeEd25519SecretSeed.description: Decodes psrkey ed25519 seed to raw data.

isValidEd25519SecretSeed.name: isValidEd25519SecretSeed
isValidEd25519SecretSeed.description: Returns true if the given Payshares secret key is a valid ed25519 secret seed.

decodeSha256Hash.name: decodeSha256Hash
decodeSha256Hash.description: Decodes psrkey sha256 hash to raw data.

FastSigning.name: FastSigning
FastSigning.description: Use this flag to check if fast signing (provided by ed25519 package) is available. If your app is signing a large number of transaction or verifying a large number of signatures make sure ed25519 package is installed.

signatureBase.name: signatureBase
signatureBase.description:
Returns the "signature base" of this transaction, which is the value that, when hashed, should be signed to create a signature that validators on the Payshares Network will accept.

It is composed of a 4 prefix bytes followed by the xdr-encoded form of this transaction.

toEnvelope.name: toEnvelope
toEnvelope.description: To envelope returns a xdr.TransactionEnvelope which can be submitted to the network.

build.name: build
build.description: This will build the transaction. It will also increment the source account's sequence number by 1.

best_r.name: best_r
best_r.description: Calculates and returns the best rational approximation of the given real number.
